Theology home>
Theology Modules for the CCRS at TASC is delivered via the Open Learning format (i.e., like Open University, from a distance, only less of one for TASC students).
<li> Modules available in 2005/6 will be: Liturgy, Worship and the Sacraments
• Tutorial support will be provided, on an individual basis for each module.
• Expect to spend a half day each week in term time working on each module, with the vacation for completing the assessed essay.
ALL students must register for EACH separate module they will undertake over the coming months.
If you are studying Theology with Primary Education, you will automatically receive one credit each for:
i) the module on Religious Education (no. 7),
iv) Jesus Christ from your Theology course.

BUT to get the CCRS you MUST also successfully complete the CCRS modules on Christian Morality, The Church, and Liturgy, Worship and the Sacraments, as well as the education option on Catholic Education.

If you are studying Single Honours Theology you do NOT REQUIRE the CCRS as the level of theology you have studied exceeds that of the CCRS and in undertaking the certificate you would only duplicate work which you have already covered. The CCRS Administrator can supply you with an explanatory letter if schools request one (FASS Office, AF44).
The Education Modules will NOT be Open Learning but part of the RE and Catholic Education Modules offered by the Faculty of Education.
• Primary Education students will gain one CCRS credit for completing their RE Module (PED 220/2 and PED 3200/2).

• All Primary Education students will also have to undertake the Catholic Education module (PED 4031) and select ONE of the components of this module (i.e. either Professional module 8 or 9 as listed above in the College Scheme) as best suits their professional needs and overall profile of attainment for their CCRS registry transcript.
• Secondary PGCE students gain credits for both professional components (Ethos of a Catholic School and Identifying a Personal Contribution to a Catholic School ) of the Catholic Education option.
ALL Education students will need to gain six further CCRS credits via the theology modules to gain the CCRS certificate. This means a total of EIGHT credits are needed ­
column2: TWO from Education and SIX from Theology.
40 for Each Module (cheque payable to TASC Dept. of Theology).

column1: 3. Also, collect a TASC CCRS Course Details Handbook (Green cover - alternatively, this may be downloaded from http://www.cesew.org.uk/temp/ccrsspcoursesphandbook.pdf) and a BLUE National Handbook from the Catholic Education Service.
